name: Wenqi
content:
H1: Wenqi Fan
Assistant Professor
, Faculty of Engineering
, Business School

Office: PQ743, Mong Man Wai Building, Hung Hom, Kowloon, Hong Kong SAR.

name: Wenqi
content:
H2: Short Bio
Dr. Wenqi Fan is currently an Assistant Professor of the Department of Computing (COMP) & Department of Management and Marketing (MM), The Hong Kong Polytechnic University (PolyU). Before that, he was a Research Assistant Professor and a Postdoctoral Fellow at PolyU (2020-2023). He received his Ph.D. degree in computer science from the City University of Hong Kong (2017-2020), under the supervision of and . 
From 2018 to 2021, he was a  research scholar of at Michigan State University (MSU), under the supervision of . 
He is recognized as the AI 2000 Most Influential Scholar Honorable Mention ( , , ) , and one of the World’s Top 2% Scientists by Stanford University (2023, 2024). 
His research has been supported by multiple government research fund agencies, including Hong Kong Research Grants Council ( RGC-GRF ), National Natural Science Foundation of China ( NSFC ), Hong Kong Innovation and Technology Commission ( ITF ), etc.

name: Wenqi
content: He has published his research in highly ranked journals and top conference proceedings [ ].

name: Wenqi
content:
>>> Welcome to contact me if you are interested in interdisciplinary research (collaborating with our group) using Data Mining/Machine Learning/Artificial Intelligence!



H2: Research Interests [Google Scholar]
Data Mining, Machine Learning, and Artificial Intelligence, with a particular focus on:



• Recommender Systems (RecSys)andManagement Information Systems (MIS)
• Large Language Models (LLMs)
• Trustworthy AI: Adversarial Attacks & Robustness; Fairness; Explainability, etc.
• Graph Machine Learning: Graph Neural Networks; Graph Foundation Models
• AI/ML/DM + X: Business; Science.



>>> Our research group are actively recruiting self-motivated Postdoc, Ph.D. students,Dual PhD Degree students, MPhil/Msc, and Research Assistants , etc. 
Visiting scholars, interns, and self-funded students are also welcome. 
Send me an email if you are interested (Year-round Recruitment).
[ ]

content:

H2: News
• 2024

name: Wenqi
content:
• 09/2024: One paper (Multi-agent Attacks for Black-box Social Recommendations) got accepted byACM TOIS 2024. Congratulations to Shijie.
• 09/2024: Our new preprint “SSD4Rec: A Structured State Space Duality Model for Efficient Sequential Recommendation” is online.
• 08/2024: Check out our survey onA Survey of Mamba.
• 06/2024: Gratefully receive a grant (RGC-GRF) as the PI to support our research on Large Language Models and Recommender Systems. Multiple PhD/Postdoc/RA positions are available (Year-round Recruitment). [Please click here for position details.]
• 06/2024: Our new preprint “TokenRec: Learning to Tokenize ID for LLM-based Generative Recommendation” is online.
• 05/2024: Our survey paper&tutorial (A Survey on RAG Meets LLMs: Towards Retrieval-Augmented Large Language Models) got accepted byKDD 2024.  Congratulations to Yujuan, Liangbo and Shijie. [Website]
• 05/2024: One paper got accepted byKDD 2024.  Congratulations to Liangbo and Shijie.

name: Wenqi
content:
• 03/2024: I was recognized as the “2024 AI 2000 Most Influential Scholar Honorable Mention”  in the field of IR and Recommendation by the AMiner.
• 03/2024: One demo paper (“FashionReGen: LLM-Empowered Fashion Report Generation”)  and one short paper (“Interpretation-Empowered Neural Cleanse for Backdoor Attacks”) got accepted byACM TheWeb Conference (WWW) 2024. Congratulations to Yujuan and Liangbo.
• 01/2024: Two papers (“Linear-Time Graph Neural Networks for Scalable Recommendations” and “Fast Graph Condensation with Structure-based Neural Tangent Kernel”) got accepted byACM TheWeb Conference (WWW) 2024.  Congratulations to Jiahao ZHANG, Lin WANG, and Jiatong LI.
• 01/2024: One paper (“Revisiting Link Prediction: A data perspective”) got accepted byICLR 2024.

name: Wenqi
content:
• 05/2022: Our survey paper (Trustworthy AI: A Computational Perspective[Arxiv]) is accepted byACM TIST.
In the survey, we examineSIXdimensions in achieving trustworthy AI, including(i) Safety & Robustness, (ii) Non-discrimination & Fairness, (iii) Explainability, (iv) Privacy, (v) Accountability & Auditability, and (vi) Environmental Well-Being, and review the latest research works in each dimension from a computational perspective.



• 04/2022: Our new preprint “Automated Machine Learning for Deep Recommender Systems: A Survey” is online.
• 04/2022: 1 paper (Graph Trend Filtering Networks for Recommendation[Arxiv] [Code-Pytorch]) got accepted bySIGIR’2022.
• 03/2022: I am invited to serve as a reviewer forNeurIPS 2022.
• 03/2022: I was recognized as “2022年AI 2000人工智能最具影响力学者提名奖！” (“2022 AI 2000 Most Influential Scholar Honorable Mention”  in Information Retrieval and Recommendation) based on the Tsinghua-AMiner academic data.榜单链接Link.
